File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\HAG_GurHunter_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Astarion meets a Gur Hunter that reveals he's hunting a vampire spawn - Astarion himself, although the hunter doesn't realise this. Astarion starts with a mocking tone, but once he realises the hunter's purpose he tries to get some information before leaving or killing the hunter.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\HAG_GurHunter_OM_Astarion_COM.lsj
Synopsis:
Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion, although he doesn't realise his quarry is standing in front of him.) At first Astarion thinks its funny to meet a monster hunter (as he's a monster) but turns sour when he discovers that he's the target.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\PLA_GithChokepoint_OM_Laezel_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Kithrak Voss, the knight hunting Lae'zel, rides in on a dragon and kills flaming fist on a bridge. Lae'zel approaches, thinking he might lead her to a creche, where she can bec ured of the tadpole. SVoss is spoiled, intelligent, and creepily calm and fatherly: Joaquin Phoenix in Gladiator. Smarmy and evil sounding. Pronunciation: Qudenos = cue-DAY-noss. Ghaik = GAYK. Kith'rak = KITH-rack. Lae'zel = lay-ZELL. Vlaakith = VLAH-kith.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\PLA_GithChokepoint_OM_Laezel_COM.lsj
Synopsis:
Kithrak Voss, the knight hunting Lae'zel, rides in on a dragon and kills flaming fist on a bridge. Lae'zel approaches, thinking he might lead her to a creche, where she can bec ured of the tadpole. SVoss is spoiled, intelligent, and creepily calm and fatherly: Joaquin Phoenix in Gladiator. Smarmy and evil sounding. Pronunciation: Qudenos = cue-DAY-noss. Ghaik = GAYK. Kith'rak = KITH-rack. Lae'zel = lay-ZELL. Vlaakith = VLAH-kith.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\WYR_VampireSpawns_OM_Astarion_COM.lsj
Synopsis:
Dalyria and Petras at the flophouse. They are looking for Astarion at the place where they used to "hunt". This is a dialog for when they meet Astarion-companion with player-Avatar. They will tell Astarion they must inform Cazador that Astarion is back in the city. They will also reveal that Cazador is planning a ritual that requires all the spawn and that will grant them new powers. If the player & Astarion know that Cazador is actually planning to sacrifice all the spawn, he might be able to convince the spawn about this sacrifice. In exchange, they will reveal a bit of information about Cazador's Palace. After the dialog they disappear as clouds of mist.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\WYR_VampireSpawns_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Dalyria and Petras at the flophouse. They are looking for Astarion at the place where they used to "hunt". This is a dialog for when they meet Astarion-Avatar or Astarion-Companion with the player-Avatar. They will tell Astarion they must inform Cazador that Astarion is back in the city. They will also reveal that Cazador is planning a ritual that requires all the spawn and that will grant them new powers. If Astarion knows that Cazador is actually planning to sacrifice all the spawn, he might be able to convince the spawn about this sacrifice. In exchange, they will reveal a bit of information about Cazador's Palace. After the dialog, they disappear as clouds of mist.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\WYR_MeetingMizora.lsj
Synopsis:
Dialog with mizora at Wyrm's Rock near the entrance to Lower city. You see Ravengard taken away, and Mizora tells you to meet him in camp. Version if Wyll is not there.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\WYR_KillDirectorGortash_Ceremony_OM_Karlach_COM.lsj
Synopsis:
Ceremony of Gortash becoming the Grand Duke. The start of the dialog depends on whether Steel Watchers are enabled (present) or not. In the dialog Gortash tells you to kill Orin and then concludes the ceremony. Player can attack but it would be very hard to win.

Karlach confronts Gortash after ceremony in WYR. In this dialogue, Karlach is facing the man who sold her to the devil. She hasn't talked to him in 10 years and she's furious for his betrayal. The player can allow Karlach to fight him here, but in most cases they won't.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\WYR_GortashConfrontation_OM_KarlachAndGortashEncounter_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Dialog with Gortash in his office. Possible outcomes: 1. You visited Steel Foundry and the destroyed Control Centre - he attacks you. 2. You visited Steel Foundry, didn't destroy the Control Centre, but someone activated Dead Man switch which destroyed Iron T hrone. He attacks you. 3. You visited Iron Throne which caused the destruction of it. He tells you - "I warned you" and then attacks you. 4. You didn't kill Orin. 5. You killed Orin and you have both Netherstones. 6. Fallback node which includes the case where you killed Orin, but didn't bring either of the netherstones.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\GOB_SeluneTemple_OM_ShadowHeart_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Shadowheart pauses and reflects to herself after entering the main chamber of what was once an impressive temple dedicated to the moon goddess, Selune. Being a worshipper of Selune's rival, Shar, Shadowheart is satisfied to see the temple ruined and full of goblins, but also is curious as to what happened. She may suspect that fellow Sharrans were active in the region at some point in the past, and may have been responsible for the temple's desecration.

Synopsis:
Shadowheart reacts to taking offerings made at a shrine to Sel√ªne, the rival of her goddess Shar. If Shadowheart is the avatar, she has a moment of introspection where she considers if she should take the items of not. If Shadowheart is a companion, she encourages the player to not take the items. The player can try talk her around, and may discover she is a Shar worshipper if they don't already know. The outcome of this dialogue potentially strengthens or damages Shadowheart's opinion of the player.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\SHA_NightsongPrison_OM_Shadowheart_COM.lsj
Synopsis:
If Shar/Shadowheart have told the player about the Spear of Night, they will be given once last reminder to find it before entering the Shadowfell. If the player refuses twice, SH will turn hostile COM: Shadowheart refuses to enter the Shadowfell without the spear. If the player refuses to search for it then Shadowheart leaves the party

Synopsis:
Spear AOM/OOM: Shar reveals the final step to Shadowheart. She must kill the Selunite, Nightsong, and rise as Shar's loyal servant. No spear AOM: Shar reminds Shadowheart to find the spear. The player (as SH) can choose whether or not to find the spear, and can enter the Shadowfell without the spear No spear OOM: Shar reminds Shadowheart to get the spear.

Synopsis:
Shadowheart meets with her parents once again, who have been imprisoned for decades. A vision of Shar appears and demands Shadowheart sacrifice her parents. Note: there are two major tracks in this scene - if SH comes to it as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess's command, or as someone who has turned from Shar and is coming to rescue her parents.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_SharGrotto_ParentsFate_OM_Shadowheart_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Avatar Shadowheart meets with her parents once again, who have been imprisoned for decades. A vision of Shar appears and demands Shadowheart sacrifice her parents. Note: there are two major tracks in this scene - if SH comes to it as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess's command, or as someone who has turned from Shar and is coming to rescue her parents.

Synopsis:
Shadowheart meets with her old friend once again. Talking about the past and discussing what the future is going to look like. Nocturne is a MtF transgender character, which Shadowheart may realise after piecing together information from a fragmented memory she recalled before.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_SharGrotto_ConfrontViconia_OM_Shadowheart_COM.lsj
Synopsis:
Shadowheart confronts Viconia about her past and potentially the leadership of the cult itself. Alternatively, she may be here to free her parents, if she has abandoned Shar. The player can support her efforts and help her defeat Viconia, or else betray her.

Synopsis:
Shadowheart confronts Viconia about her past and potentially the leadership of the cult itself. Alternatively, she may just seek to fight her former mistress in order to free her parents, should she know they're alive.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_JaheiraAndSon02_OM_Jaheira_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
OOM for Jaheira and Jaheira's grandson with player nowhere near. He's a timid and frightened little boy who's brave on the inside but his cousins tease him because he gets scared easily, his cowardly-but-brave behaviour is all a setup for Jaheira to have a sweet little moment where she can have a nice little cathartic nod to Khalid and encourage the kid, because she believes in him, and leads to a moment where the player can contextualise this into her current dilemma - She was quick to determine that he was gone, but that was in her headstrong days when all was more...black and white. Now she has these doubts on whether she should be even considering having her life pace slowed by rite of simply being a strong druid or not. Same beats as the COM version, with a slight edit at the choice moment.

uid: 06feed1d-4d81-941c-6ea5-17e810582c7a
> Who said?

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_JaheiraAndDaughter03_OM_Jaheira_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Jaheira OOM - Jaheira's youngest daughter is practicing with a sword outside the front door - she's demanding, inquisitive and insistent in a way you would imagine a younger Jaheira might have been. This conversation prompts when Jaheira returns for the first time, and I was aiming at this proposing "Baldurs Gate always need saving and so few are capabler" to play into Jaheira's personal dilemma. Very similar to the COM but instead of the player being able to suggest Baldur's Gate can cope without her, the daughter makes her feel integral to it.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_Guildhall_Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Origin moment for Minsc with Roah. After Minsc learns of the Zhentarim plans to overthrow Nine-Fingers, he returns to the Guildhall to confront their leader, Roah. She taunts him with his past evil deeds as the 'Stone Lord' - the player decideds whether to back Minsc and fight Roah, or let Roah's plan come to fruition for the 'greater good'. ATTN: This double origin moment was degraded to a single origin moment with only Minsc

uid: 26b15a81-4471-6311-9963-f4309621504d

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_Elminster_OM_Gale_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Elminster greets Gale after he's completed Sorcerous Sundries and learned how to reforge the Crown of Karsus, either outside the shop, or in camp. Elminster tells Gale that Mystra requires him to come speak with her in teh Stormshore Tabernacle, where he will learn the truth about the orb.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_CazadorsPalace_RitualRoom_PreCombat_OM_Astarion_AOM_COM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Cazador greets Companion or Avatar Astarion in the ritual room, pleased Astarion has returned and he'll finally be able to complete the ritual. The other 6 vampire spawn are in their places for the ritual, ringing the room, held in spectral chains. Astarion starts nervous, but gets angrier as Cazador goads him until Astarion attacks. Cazador uses his magic to immobilise Astarion and then telekinetically flings him into his place (a spot directly behind Cazador) for the ritual, which then begins as the dialog ends and combat starts.

Synopsis:
Astarion addresses a defeated Cazador after their fight. He pulls his former master from the coffin where he's recovering and has to decide what to do with him - kill him or carve the scars on Astarion's back into Cazador's and then use him as a sacrifice in the ritual.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_CazadorsPalace_Cells_OM_Astarion_COM.lsj
Synopsis:
COM dialog with the prisoners in Cazador's Palace. Astarion meets Sebastian - a young man he seduced and brought to Cazador - for the first time in 170 years. Astarion was sure Sebastian was dead, but Cazador secretly turned him into a vampire spawn. If you aggrevate Sebastian, he'll be so full of hate and pain that he'll curse you.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_CazadorsPalace_Cells_OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
AOM/OOM dialog with the prisoners in Cazador's Palace. Astarion meets Sebastian - a young man he seduced and brought to Cazador - for the first time in 170 years. Astarion was sure Sebastian was dead, but Cazador secretly turned him into a vampire spawn. If you aggrevate Sebastian, he'll be so full of hate and pain that he'll curse you.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\LOW_BhaalTemple_OM_OrinDarkUrge_AOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Orin, Chosen of Bhaal resides in Bhaal Temple, waiting for the players to arrive. She has given them an ultimatum to kill Gortash and retrieve his Netherstone for her, or the players' abducted companion will be sacrified. If the players didn't have a valid companion for kidnapping, a random citizen will take the place of sacrifice. Orin has multiple reactivity to the player's previous actions. - was Orin attacked during her Impersonations several times? - are players Unholy Assassins? - did/didn't players kill Gortash? - are players DarkUrge? - did Orin kidnap a romance partner, friend or random citizen? - did players kill Sarevok? - was Orin warned of the players coming and therefore kills the victim immediately? Regardless of the various player choices, Orin will eventually begin a fight with the players, determined to prove to Bhaal and herself that she is a worthy Chosen of Bhaal. If players had rejected the Dark Urge earlier, she will turn into the Slayer before combat.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\INT_GithyankiAmbush_VossDecision_OM_Laezel_COM.lsj
Synopsis:
The player must pick between siding with Voss and helping Orpheus or siding with Vlaakith's Inquisitor in killing Orpheus. Laezel is predisposed to a certain faction depending on the outcome of the Creche, but can be convinced by the player to swing to the other faction. A fight results with the opposing party and Laezel can leave the party and be hostile if not convinced to side with the Player's decision.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\INT_GithyankiAmbush_VossDecision_OM_Laezel_AOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Avatar Laezel must pick between siding with Voss and helping Orpheus or siding with Vlaakith's Inquisitor in helping them kill Orpheus. They both lead to a fight with the opposing party.

Synopsis:
If Mattis makes it to HAV and speaks with Karlach, he will recognize her from the Blood Wars. Karlach then will give him a good advice. If companion Wyll is nearby he will join the conversation.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\DEN_ThingLikeMe_OM_Laezel_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Note: T|his dialogue has a lot of copies of certain branches for cinematics purposes. Do not try to condense without speaking to writer or cinematics! Lae'zel confronts a tiefling that has seen another githyanki. She tries to prise the information from him with intimidation, perhaps insisting he bow to show proper deference. Key emotions: Lae'zel is arrogant and fearsome; Zorru is afraid she will attack, but tries not to show it - at first.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\CRE_ChainOfCommand_Vlaakith_OM_Laezel_AOM_OOM.lsj
Synopsis:
Laezel meets Vlaaktih as a hologram. Avatar can decide if she accepts her orders to kill the prisoner or refuse. In both cases, the planecaster is activated.If you refuse, Vlaakith orders the inquisitor if alive to kill you if you try to exit the room or theatens to hunt you down if he's already dead. Orphan Laezel automatically accepts Vlaakith's orders.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch0_Hotfix3_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Companions\Origin_Moments\CRE_ChainOfCommand_Vlaakith_OM_Laezel_COM.lsj
Synopsis:
Vlaaktih appears as a hologram and Laezel meets her for the first time. Avatar can decide if she accepts her orders to kill the prisoner or refuse. In both cases, the planecaster is activated.If you refuse, Vlaakith orders the inquisitor if alive to kill you if you try to exit the room or theatens to hunt you down if he's already dead. If Laezel is not yet convinced to side with the player, they have a chance to do it here if they refuse.

Synopsis:
|COM branch for Laezel interacting with the Zaith'isk. She is convinced the machine is there to cure her and refuses to open her eyes to the reality that it's killing her. The player can intervene and stop it, or let it play out. Eventually, the device explodes and the doctor calls the guards.|

Synopsis:
Post EA version of FOR_Village_OM_ShadowHeart_AOM_PostEA After finding Sharan crown on a skeleton, an old journal speaking of local disappearances or a defiled statue of Selune, Shadowheart recognises that the ruined village of Moonhaven was attacked by Shar worshippers at some point and realises she may have allies nearby. While she's contemplating this, she experiences a flicker of strange magic. If present, her companions may notice this and ask what's the matter - she can be truthful or not, knowing that leading the party to a Shar stronghold could end in the deaths of some companions.

While she's contemplating this, she experiences a flicker of strange magic. Her companions may notice this and ask what's the matter - she can be truthful or not, knowing that leading the party to a Shar stronghold could end in the deaths of some companions.
